quotes.quote: Cheerfulness and contentment are great beautifiers, and are famous preservers of good looks.
Laughing cheerfulness throws the light of day on all the paths of life.
The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
And so of cheerfulness, or a good temper—the more it is spent, the more of it remains.
Be cheerful—the problems that worry us most are those that never arrive.
You find yourself refreshed in the presence of cheerful people. Why not make an honest effort to confer that pleasure on others?
Cheerfulness keeps up a kind of daylight in the mind, filling it with a steady and perpetual serenity.
A healthy and wholesome cheerfulness is not necessarily impossible to any occupation.
Repose and cheerfulness are the badge of the gentleman — repose in energy.
Cheerfulness is health; its opposite, melancholy, is disease
The most manifest sign of wisdom is continued cheerfulness.
Cheerfulness is the atmosphere in which all things thrive.
Nothing is more beautiful than cheerfulness in an old face
Cheerfulness in most cheerful people, is the rich and satisfying result of strenuous discipline.
Cheerfulness greases the axles of the world.

Cheerfulness removes the rust from the mind, lubricates our inward machinery, and enables us to do our work with fewer creaks and ;groans. If people were universally cheerful, probably there wouldn't be half the quarreling or a tenth part of the wickedness.
The cheerful live longest in years, and afterwards in our regards. Cheerfulness is the off-shoot of goodness.
The path to cheerfulness is to sit cheerfully and to act and speak as if cheerfulness were already there.
Cheerfulness is a very great help in fostering the virtue of charity. Cheerfulness itself is a virtue.
The man who radiates good cheer, who makes life happier wherever he meets it, is always a man of vision and faith.
Courage and cheerfulness will not only carry you over the rough places in life, but will enable you to bring comfort and help to the weak-hearted and will console you in the sad hours.

Cheerfulness is as natural to the heart of a man in strong health as color to his cheek; and wherever there is habitual gloom there must be either bad air, unwholesome food, improperly severe labor, or erring habits of life.
Cheerfulness prepares a glorious mind for all the noblest acts.
Cheerfulness is like money well expended in charity; the more we dispense of it, the greater our possession.
Cheerfulness is the best promoter of health and is as friendly to the mind as to the body.
Cheerfulness is an offshoot of goodness and of wisdom.
If there is a virtue in the world at which we should always aim, it is cheerfulness.
Let cheerfulness on happy fortune wait.
